posts.post_content: Had someone draw both this and Ajani against me in a draft, and get them both out. Although infinite turns is tough, consistent extra turns is not. It very quickly became where I was taking 1 turn for every 2-3 of theirs. Made for a crazy game though. They hit that, and Ajani's 100 and I still barely won w/ Constellation and Armament of Nyx.
posts.html:
Had someone draw both this and Ajani against me in a draft, and get them both out. Although infinite turns is tough, consistent extra turns is not. It very quickly became where I was taking 1 turn for every 2-3 of theirs. Made for a crazy game though. They hit that, and Ajani's 100 and I still barely won w/ Constellation and Armament of Nyx.

posts.post_content:
It is actually surprisingly easy to get massive numbers of turns from this card, especially in my BUG +1/+1 counter ramp. With cards such as [Renegade Krasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Renegade Krasis), [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer), and [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace), his 5 counter requirement becomes trivial.  
  
Using cards like [Give // Take](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Give // Take) and [Vorel of the Hull Clade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorel of the Hull Clade), in addition with [Bioshift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bioshift) and [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace), he can be ramped up to massive numbers of counters with extreme ease.   
  
If I do it properly, I can have Sage of Hours at over 5,000 counters when it enters, resulting in one thousand turns. While 5 - 10 extra turns is more likely, it isn't much of a step up to take thousands of turns. Using [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer), [Corpsejack Menace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpsejack Menace), [Vorel of the Hull Clade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorel of the Hull Clade), and [Kalonian Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalonian Hydra) (and an opponent who didn't want to forfeit),... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
